intro: Thoracostachyum macilentulum, commonly known as the slender thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, pale flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when ripe. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
